name: Matriciani
description: Similar to spaghetti, but with folded strands.

name: Fedelini
description: An especially thin variety of spaghetti.

name: Donizetti
description: Gaetano Donizetti (1797-1848) was one of the most notable opera composers of the 19th century.

name: Campagnoli
description: Bartolomeo Campagnoli (1751-1827) was a touring virtuoso violinist as well as an admired composer.

name: Galuppi
description: Baldassare Galuppi (1706-1785) was a successful composer who spent time in London and St Petersburg.

name: Bigoli
description: A thick pasta made from buckwheat or wholewheat flour.

name: Capellini
description: A pasta that literally translates as 'thin hair' in Italian.

name: Boccherini
description: Luigi Boccherini (1743-1805) was most famous for his popular Minuet from the string quartet in E.

name: Busoni
description: Ferruccio Busoni (1866-1924) was a forward-thinking composer who was famous for his pioneering piano works.

name: Alfano
description: Franco Alfano (1875-1954) was best known for his opera Risurrezione, written in 1904.

name: Frescobaldi
description: Girolamo Frescobaldi (1583-1643) was an early baroque composer and keyboard specialist.

name: Bucatini
description: A pasta similar to spaghetti, but with a hole running through the centre.

name: Fusilli
description: A twirled pasta shape derived from the Italian word 'fuso', meaning 'spun'.

name: Perciatelli
description: Similar to spaghetti, but with folded strands, identical to Matriciani.
